text: - Respiratory insufficiency - Short finger - Short foot - Short long bone - Short neck - Short palm - Short ribs - Short thorax - Short toe - Splenomegaly - Thoracic dysplasia - Ventricular septal defect - Wide intermamillary distance - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough est
